poem:
RE/style Dreams

In a room of threads,  
pre-loved whispers weave,  
eight hands craft futures,  
fingers stitch ambition  
into cloth once lost—  
fear hums with the seams.  
Judges' eyes, like needles,  
pierce hope, untangle dreams.  
Fashion's fleeting dance  
beneath lights' sudden blaze—  
youth drapes in courage  
on this fabric stage.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "RE/style recap: Ep1 – meet the eight designers competing on Vinted’s new fashion show What happens when you throw eight fashion designers together with a wonderful wardrobe of pre-loved pieces, add in a career-defining prize, plus a healthy (ish!) dose of terror? RE/style, the new competition series on Prime Video. The concept is simple: across six weeks, the show follows a handpicked group of talented young designers, who are given challenges by the show’s judges". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: RE/style recap: Ep1 – meet the eight designers competing on Vinted’s new fashion show What happens when you throw eight fashion designers together with a wonderful wardrobe of pre-loved pieces, add in a career-defining prize, plus a healthy (ish!) dose of terror?
